Authors:
Steven Edward Zelski, Huzefa A Raja, Andrew N. Miller,
Carol A. Shearer
Title:
Conioscypha peruensis sp. nov., its phylogenetic placement
based on 28S rRNA gene, and a report of Conioscypha gracilis from
Perú
Keywords:
altitudinal gradient, freshwater ascomycetes, LSU,
submerged wood
Abstract:
The previously undescribed fungus Conioscypha peruensis
was isolated from submerged woody debris collected in streams, rivers
and a swamp in Perú. The asexual state formed in culture and
morphological and molecular data support the inclusion in the genus. A
phylogeny generated with maximum likelihood and Bayesian approaches
placed the fungus in a well-supported clade with other Conioscypha and
Conioscyphascus species. Nomenclature used herein reflects changes made
in the Melbourne Code, with Conioscyphascus being considered a later
synonym of Conioscypha. The fungus is described, illustrated and
compared to morphologically similar taxa. In addition, Conioscypha
gracilis, is reported from both lentic and lotic habitats in Perú.
